description: Monotonically increasing packet/flow sequence ID. Row identifier with
behavioral_relevance: NONE — drop before modeling

description: Flow start time as Unix epoch (float). Used for temporal analysis and
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — temporal context; exclude from feature vector or bi

description: Flow last-packet time as Unix epoch (float). ltime - stime ≈ dur.
behavioral_relevance: LOW — redundant with dur; use dur instead

description: Argus flow flags string (e.g., 'e', 'e s', '  '). Captures TCP/UDP/ARP
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — encodes SYN/RST/FIN/ACK patterns; use flgs_number or

description: Numeric encoding of flgs. Integer representation of Argus flag bitmask
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — numeric form of flgs; prefer over string flgs for ML

description: Layer-4 protocol name string: 'tcp', 'udp', 'arp', 'icmp', etc.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — encode as ordinal or one-hot; DoS often uses one prot

description: Numeric encoding of proto. IANA protocol numbers (TCP=6, UDP=17, ICMP=
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — numeric form of proto

description: Source IP address string. Identity feature — may cause leakage if used
behavioral_relevance: IDENTITY LEAKAGE — use behavioral aggregates (TnBPSrcIP, etc

description: Source port number. -1 for ARP and other non-port protocols.
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — categorical, NOT ordinal; high ephemeral ports indi

description: Destination IP address string.
behavioral_relevance: IDENTITY LEAKAGE — repeated targets suggest DDoS victim

description: Destination port number. -1 for ARP and other non-port protocols.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — well-known ports (80, 443, 22) vs random ports indica

description: Total packet count (spkts + dpkts). High values indicate flood attacks
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — use log-transform in Phase 1 due to skew

description: Total byte count (sbytes + dbytes). Key volume indicator.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — exfiltration = large bytes; DoS = many pkts with smal

description: Argus connection state string (RST, CON, FIN, INT, REQ, ACC, CLO, etc.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — RST-heavy = scan/DoS; CON = established; FIN = clean

description: Numeric encoding of state. Prefer over state string for ML.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — numeric form of state

description: Argus flow transaction sequence number. Monotonically increases within
behavioral_relevance: LOW — sequence context only; not a behavioral feature

description: Flow duration in seconds (ltime - stime). Zero for sub-millisecond flo
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — very short = probes/scans; very long = exfiltration /

description: Mean of per-packet statistics (IAT or size) over the flow.
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — regular mean = automated traffic; irregular = human

description: Standard deviation of per-packet statistics. Zero = perfectly uniform
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — zero stddev in DoS floods is a strong attack indica

description: Sum of packet size statistics over the flow. Related to bytes.
behavioral_relevance: LOW — redundant with bytes

description: Minimum packet size in flow.
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — min≈max = uniform flood

description: Maximum packet size in flow.
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — max = MTU-sized = large payload transfer

description: Source-to-destination packet count.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — asymmetric spkts≫dpkts = one-way flood

description: Destination-to-source packet count.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — zero dpkts = unanswered scan

description: Source-to-destination byte count.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — large sbytes = upload / exfiltration

description: Destination-to-source byte count.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — zero dbytes + high sbytes = attack probe / flood

description: Overall flow rate in bytes/second. rate = bytes / dur.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — extreme rate = DDoS; log-transform required

description: Source-side flow rate (sbytes / dur).
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — srate≫drate = upload flood

description: Destination-side flow rate (dbytes / dur).
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — drate≫srate = download flood / amplification

description: Total bytes from source IP in a recent time window. UNSW-engineered st
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — high value = this IP is sending a lot

description: Total bytes to destination IP in a recent time window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — high value = this IP is being flooded (DDoS victim)

description: Total packets from source IP in a recent time window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — high = scanning / DoS src

description: Total packets to destination IP in a recent time window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — high = target under attack

description: Total packets for this protocol in a recent time window. Captures prot
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — extreme value = protocol-specific flooding

description: Total packets to this destination port in a recent time window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — high = port-specific attack (e.g., HTTP flood on port

description: Average rate: protocol × source IP in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — captures per-protocol per-source flooding rate

description: Average rate: protocol × destination IP in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — captures DDoS victim under specific protocol

description: Number of inbound connections to destination IP in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — extreme = DDoS target

description: Number of inbound connections from source IP in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — extreme = src is a botnet node

description: Average rate: protocol × source port in window.
behavioral_relevance: MEDIUM — ephemeral ports make this noisier

description: Average rate: protocol × destination port in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — captures service-specific attack rate

description: Packets with this state × protocol × destination IP in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — RST×TCP×specific_IP = targeted reset flooding

description: Packets with this state × protocol × source IP in window.
behavioral_relevance: HIGH — captures stateful pattern per source

description: Binary attack label: 0 = Normal traffic, 1 = Attack traffic.
behavioral_relevance: PRIMARY LABEL — target variable for binary classification

description: Attack category string: 'Normal', 'DoS', 'DDoS', 'Reconnaissance', 'Th
behavioral_relevance: MULTI-CLASS LABEL — 5 categories; use for multi-class classi

description: Fine-grained attack subtype: 'HTTP', 'UDP', 'TCP', 'Keylogging', 'Data
behavioral_relevance: FINE-GRAINED LABEL — most specific class; use for hierarchic
